title: [Large-Scale] TPACK-Based Art Technology Development Courseware Design: Integrating Scientific Inquiry (Experiment-Analysis-Evidence) and Creative Expression

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic art theory and design principles, foundational grasp of the scientific inquiry process (observation-hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion), variable control, and data interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Online learning in restricted technological environments utilizing smartphones as the primary medium for pre-service/in-service teachers. Application of a quantitative (engagement, completion scores) and qualitative (creativity, expression evaluation) assessment system for digital artifacts, emphasizing objective evaluation using scientific analysis tools (e.g., image analysis software).

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more foundational art techniques (sketching, color theory, digital drawing) to the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formulation–experimentation–analysis–conclusion) using digital tools, with a focus on deriving measurable outcomes through variable control.

Learners can submit a lesson design plan that integrates the three core elements of the TPACK framework (technology, pedagogy, content), applies three or more variable control strategies (e.g., standardizing experimental conditions, maintaining tool consistency), and achieves over 80% peer evaluation scores by referencing evidence-based approaches (two or more research papers/case studies).

Learners can complete mobile-friendly art education projects (portfolio creation, virtual exhibition planning) and produce learning outcomes combining quantitative metrics (engagement, completeness) and qualitative analysis (creativity, expressiveness).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
